COMMIT.MESSAGE: rm --force work for more than one arg When we remove with --force we do not return a error if the input does not exists, however if we get more than on input we must try to remove all and not just NOP out and not remove anything just because one arg did not exists. Also make the code simpler for commands that do have the --ignore option and just make --force imply --ignore which reduces the ugly error handling. Fixes #21529 Signed-off-by: Paul Holzinger <pholzing@redhat.com>
